TEXT.id: PaiwanCh2_027_DEER, WILD PIG, GOAT AND MUNTJAC DEER
TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: venan vavuy sizi takets (Tjakuvukuvuł village, p.199)

S.FORM: ka sitsuayan izua zua ti sa Vuluvulung.
ka sicoayan izoa zoa ti sa Volovolong.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there was a person called Vuluvulung (or Savuluvulung; or Old Granny?).

S.FORM: manu padjumak tua ałak a uqałay mavavuvavuy itjua łitsaq.
mano padjomak toa aljak a oqaljay mavavovavoy itjoa ljicaq.
S.TRANSL: She/he found a boy crawling in the mud.

S.FORM: qau alapen azua ałak, sa pakiramata-i, sa paitungi, sa pakani.
qao alapen azoa aljak, sa pakiramata-i, sa paitongi, sa pakani.
S.TRANSL: She took the child, washed, clothed and fed it.

S.FORM: "paulaan tu meqatsa," aya ti sa Vuluvulung.
"paolaan to meqaca," aya ti sa Volovolong.
S.TRANSL: “A pity if it doesn’t grow up,” said Vuluvulung.

S.FORM: manu meqatsa.
mano meqaca.
S.TRANSL: And the child grew up.

S.FORM: azua ti sa Vuluvulung ka tsemalis tua leklek a ta qapiz, sa vaik a sema tsemtsemel, katsuin azua kakeḍian.
azoa ti sa Volovolong ka cemalis toa leklek a ta qapiz, sa vaik a sema cemcemel, kacoin azoa kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: Vuluvulung made a single braided cord of hemp twine, and went to the woods, taking the child.

S.FORM: "djadjasu tsu tjektjek nua tsalis," ayain.
"djadjaso co tjektjek noa calis," ayain.
S.TRANSL: “Take hold of the end of the cord,” the child was told.

S.FORM: qau djadjasen nua kakeḍian.
qao djadjasen noa kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: So the child took hold of it.

S.FORM: vaik ti sa Vuluvulung i palinguł tua tsemtsemel, sa papetsevungi a tsalis a sema tjua kakeḍian; sa viłviłi a tsalis.
vaik ti sa Volovolong i palingolj toa cemcemel, sa papecevongi a calis a sema tjoa kakedrian; sa viljvilji a calis.
S.TRANSL: Vuluvulung went round the woods, and brought the ends of the cord together to where the child was, and pulled on the cord.

S.FORM: qau mapengeḍuq a kasiw a mapułat.
qao mapengedroq a kasiw a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: And all the trees were snapped off.

S.FORM: vaik a sema tapaw.
vaik a sema tapaw.
S.TRANSL: They went back to the house.

S.FORM: tsuatsuay anga pagału matsay a kasiw.
coacoay anga pagaljo macay a kasiw.
S.TRANSL: After quite a long time the trees died;

S.FORM: łamain, sa tjuguti tua lavu nua vaqu.
ljamain, sa tjogoti toa lavo noa vaqo.
S.TRANSL: she burnt them off, and sowed millet chaff.

S.FORM: tsuatsuay anga pagału, "sa-u, kiqenetji a tja tjinugut," ayain azua ałak ni sa Vuluvulung.
coacoay anga pagaljo, "sa-o, kiqenetji a tja tjinogot," ayain azoa aljak ni sa Volovolong.
S.TRANSL: After quite a long time Vuluvulung said to the child: “Go and look at what we sowed.”

S.FORM: vaik azua ałak a kiqenetj.
vaik azoa aljak a kiqenetj.
S.TRANSL: The child went to look,

S.FORM: mangtjez a ałak a nakiqenetj.
mangtjez a aljak a nakiqenetj.
S.TRANSL: and came back after looking.

S.FORM: "neka nu anema, vuvu," aya azua kakeḍian.
"neka no anema, vovo," aya azoa kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: “There’s nothing, granny,” said the child.

S.FORM: "pasaladji; nanguaq nu tsuay anga," aya ti sa Vuluvulung.
"pasaladji; nangoaq no coay anga," aya ti sa Volovolong.
S.TRANSL: “Come along; it will be all right in time,” said Vuluvulung.

S.FORM: tsuatsuay anga a uta pagału, "sa-u, kiqenetji anan," ayain ni sa Vuluvulung.
coacoay anga a ota pagaljo, "sa-o, kiqenetji anan," ayain ni sa Volovolong.
S.TRANSL: After quite a time more the child was told by Vuluvulung: “Go and have another look.”

S.FORM: vaik a kakeḍian.
vaik a kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: The child went,

S.FORM: qau mangtjez a uta.
qao mangtjez a ota.
S.TRANSL: and came back again.

S.FORM: "izuanga, vuvu, a galavagavagaw a keḍikeḍian, vuvu; qadjaw ki anema," aya azua kakeḍian.
"izoanga, vovo, a galavagavagaw a kedrikedrian, vovo; qadjaw ki anema," aya azoa kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: “Granny, now there are some small things wriggling about, granny. I don’t know what they are,” said the child.

S.FORM: "pasaladji; nanguaq nu tsuay anga."
"pasaladji; nangoaq no coay anga."
S.TRANSL: “Come along; it will be all right in time.”

S.FORM: tsuatsuay pagału a uta, "sa-u, kiqenetji anan," ayain ni sa Vuluvulung.
coacoay pagaljo a ota, "sa-o, kiqenetji anan," ayain ni sa Volovolong.
S.TRANSL: After quite a time more the child was told by Vuluvulung: “Go and have another look.”

S.FORM: vaik a kakeḍian a kiqenetj; mangtjez.
vaik a kakedrian a kiqenetj; mangtjez.
S.TRANSL: The child went to look, and came back.

S.FORM: "izuanga, vuvu, a kuḍakuḍalan a pagału; qadjaw ki anema," aya azua kakeḍian.
"izoanga, vovo, a kodrakodralan a pagaljo; qadjaw ki anema," aya azoa kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: “Now there are some quite big things, granny. I don’t know what they are,” said the child.

S.FORM: "pasaladji anan," aya ti sa Vuluvulung.
"pasaladji anan," aya ti sa Volovolong.
S.TRANSL: “Come along still (ie. let’s leave them),” said Vuluvulung.

S.FORM: tsuatsuay anga pagału a uta, vaiken ni sa Vuluvulung katua ałak a kiqenetj.
coacoay anga pagaljo a ota, vaiken ni sa Volovolong katoa aljak a kiqenetj.
S.TRANSL: After quite a time more Vuluvulung and the child went to have a look at them.

S.FORM: manu a uta kuḍalan anga, a marka venan, a vavuy, a marka sizi, marka takets, aya.
mano a ota kodralan anga, a marka venan, a vavoy, a marka sizi, marka takec, aya.
S.TRANSL: And now they were big things-deer, wild pig, goats and muntjacs, they say.

S.FORM: qau mavan anga nu sika izua nua venan nua vavuy nua sizi nua takets tutsu, aya tjautsikel a masi tsuay.
qao mavan anga no sika izoa noa venan noa vavoy noa sizi noa takec toco, aya tjaocikel a masi coay.
S.TRANSL: And that’s why there are deer, wild pigs, goats and muntjacs now, according to the old story.
